summary: This document is an email chain regarding a planned visit by officials from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The visit, scheduled for August 15, 2019, was to inspect the facility, specifically the areas related to Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death, including his cell, which was still cordoned off.

events.title: Planned MCC Inspection Visit
events.description: Officials from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York plan to visit the Metropolitan Correctional Center to inspect the 9th floor SHU, the psych observation/suicide watch area, and Jeffrey Epstein's cordoned-off cell.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: A visit to the MCC by federal prosecutors was planned for August 15, 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The specific purpose was to inspect the 9th floor Special Housing Unit (SHU), the psych observation/suicide watch area, and Epstein's cell, which was still cordoned off.
The visitors requested to be escorted only by MCC legal staff and not to speak to any guards due to ongoing investigations.
The email indicates a high level of procedural caution and the immediate investigative response to Epstein's death in custody.
